metadata.title: CVE-2020-27827 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: A flaw was found in multiple versions of OpenvSwitch. Specially crafted LLDP packets can cause memory to be lost when allocating data to handle specific optional TLVs, potentially causing a denial of service. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

criterions.comment: lldpd package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
openvswitch package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.15.0-0ubuntu1').
